intro: Arthropodium strictum, commonly known as the tufted fernbush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and produces dense clusters of narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowering stems bear small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or brownish in color. Arthropodium strictum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices.
